name: Elizabeth Enright's Melendy Family Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Name the Melendy children (before there were five) from eldest to youngest.
questions.explanation:
Mona, Rush, Randy, Oliver.

	Mona and Oliver are blond, and Randy and Rush have curly dark hair.

questions.text: Where do the Melendys live in the first book, "The Saturdays"?
questions.explanation:
New York City.

	On their Saturdays, different Melendys go to Central Park, to a beauty parlor, to the zoo, to an opera house, to an art gallery, and to a circus which I think is at Madison Square Garden.

questions.text: What's the name of the Melendy housekeeper, nanny, and substitute mother?
questions.explanation:
Cuffy.

	Her real name is Mrs. Evangeline Cuthbert-Stanley.

questions.text: What are two of Randy's foremost talents?
questions.explanation:
art and dance.

	Randy is my favorite character. When I first started reading the books she and I were about the same age. Plus, I'm a girl and a middle child like her.

questions.text: When do most of the Melendy stories take place?
questions.explanation:
in the 1940s.

	During "The Saturdays" and "The Four Story Mistake," WWII is still happening. I think it's probably over by the time of "Spiderweb for Two."

questions.text: How many Melendy books are there?
questions.explanation:
4.

	"The Saturdays," "The Four Story Mistake," "Then There Were Five," and "Spiderweb for Two."

questions.text: What distinguishes Mona from the others?
questions.explanation:
She's an actress.

	Mona becomes a real radio actress. She plays Polly Penfold on a radio soap opera called "The Penfold People."

questions.correct: He's smart, funny, musical, and athletic.
options: He's a great musician, but kind of a nerd.
He's talented but not very nice to his siblings.
He's smart and athletic but not very artistic.
questions.explanation:
He's smart, funny, musical, and athletic.

	Rush is the brother I've always wanted--in fact, if he were a grown-up man in his 40s, I'd want to marry him.

questions.text: Which is the best description of Oliver?
questions.explanation:
calm, thoughtful, scientific.

	Oliver likes to collect bugs, explore, and go places by himself. He's pretty self-sufficient for his age.

Melendy family's adopted brother.

	Mark is an orphan. He has an abusive guardian named Orrin who dies in a fire. The Melendys like Mark so much that they beg their father to adopt him--and "then there are five"!
